WRITING.TEXT: This makes me sad. I loved him when he played for us.
This is easily one of the best comments I have ever read.
I almost punched my computer at that quote. What a perversion of the system.

:/. I've had moments like that too. First thing you need to do is breathe. Relax. You are okay. Feel your feet on the floor and know that you are safe.
Now, to think rationally about it, if you are eating to maintain your weight, could you take one piece of bread and half it with the same amount of meat? That way it's the same calories and protein. When/ if you get your normal bread back, you can make your meals like you always had.
Yes yes. 100% this.

I suggest looking at websites with Buzzfeed type lists. Like the ones "ten pictures that show you are OCD" and it's misaligned crayons or dirty toilets as if that is the only form of OCD. And as if it's just a hilarious joke.

You can call the NEDA hotline (if you are in the US) and they can help you find treatment in your area in a confidential manner. Then, once you are hooked up with treatment, you can work toward opening up about it maybe. It makes you feel way better as scary as it is.
Oh yes. Thanks for correcting me!

Life without Ed by Jenny Schaffer helped me immensely. She's been through anorexia and safely in recovery and works as an eating disorder outreach person.
I also really enjoyed the diary of an exercise addict. She survived anorexia with an exercise compulsion. Parts of the book are her actual diary at the time, but most of it is her story looking back from now.
That's correct. Part of the reason why I am not a hub fan hah. I'm guessing Baraka which reopened across the street got the last of the affordable rental properties.
Meat can be healthy though. It all depends on preparation.
Smiling.
I was so sad when this place closed!

Mediterranean Cafe. Lunch only. Cash only. Hummus to die for among other things. It's on the part of state street near campus and not to be confused with Mediterranean grill(though I've heard that's good too. )
Pita pit has some good healthy options.
If you wander over toward the Atwood neighborhood at all, the Green Owl is phenomenal but all vegetarian/ vegan so if you're looking for meat, this isn't a good option.
The Nepali place (himul chuli or something that I can't spell) has some good and healthy/ light options. As does rising sons. Both places are on state with rising sons being near campus and the Nepali place being near the Capitol. Rising sons is one of my favorites on state.

I agree! I'll be curious to see how his recruiting is. He is still playing with Bo's recruits, but this winning streak with a young team is very promising.
Him picking up that technical made me smile like a little kid on Christmas.

I am not a Cal fan, but that didn't warrant him being thrown out.
Seconding this poster. Your relationship is full of red flags and you deserve better.

WRITING.TEXT: The FEAST around the dinner table forum is mostly geared toward parents trying to refers their kids, but you could maybe get some ideas to help yourself from there? They discuss all kinds of EDs there including selective eating disorder. Also know as AFRID.
Thank you! :)
I use spray Pam to cut back on oil. It works pretty well.
Congrats on the big victory!!
How did you prepare the sweet potato here?

Not a mom or caretaker of any young girls yet but as someone recovering from anorexia and exercise compulsion, I want to say that you are amazing for teaching your kid to respect what her body can do and how to fuel it in a healthy manner to become the string woman she was meant to be. Keep doing you.
There's a South Park joke here somewhere...

Have you looked at a growth chart to see where your weight was tracking to end up pre AN? You're young and most people continue to gain weight naturally into their early 20's as their body settled into it's adult form. I'm guessing the doc said you're good now because you're medically stable. Also, marked increases in cognitive functioning occurs as AN patients hit bmi 19. With that being said, I second the other person's suggestion to find a quality therapist. And that weight gain goes to the middle first to protect the vital organs.
Kudos to you for restoring weight. Doing so is incredibly brave because gaining is scary. I also admire your insight into the fact that you probably need to add more weight despite what the doctor said. I urge you to get more medical opinions and to maintain this mindset of figuring out what is healthiest for your body. Good luck with recovery!

I took it in the fall of 2014 which was the first 104 course with the new curriculum. They focus on concepts and such which makes it easier. And the professor prepared the class well for all the tests. That in addition to showing up for labs and discussion being worth so many points, made it possible for the distribution to occur. The tests being multiple choice helped too.
Brave is a good one!
The proper term is mixed race. :P
I agree with this. Looks like it is frozen along tree roots.
Oh man, that's tough. Have you looked into any ED self help books online? They aren't a replacement for formal treatment but it could help you a bit until you get in.
That sounds like a question for an officer. Why don't you call and ask them?
Does that exist?!
I did not because I was making them as a treat for my mom and she prefers plain. They'd be really good glazed and with sesame seeds on them or whatever.

2 tsp Active dry yeast 3.5 cups bread flour 1.5 tbsp granulated sugar 1.5 tsp salt 1.25 cups water
-Mix 1/2 cup of the water (it should be quite warm) with the yeast and sugar. Let it stand for 5-10 mins and get foamy. -Add the flour, salt, and most of the remaining warm water. -Kneed until the dough is smooth and doesn't stick to the bowl (took me about 10 mins). You may need to add the rest of the water to get the right consistency. -Cover the bowl with a damp towel and allow to rise for an hour. -Punch dough down and let it sit for 10 mins -Set oven to 425 and boil a pot of water -Shape the dough into 8 bagels -Boil bagels for 1-2 minutes on each side . I was closer to 2 minutes because I prefer a chewier bagel with a chewier texture. -Bake bagels for 20-25 mins on greased pan. They should be lightly golden brown and a toothpick should come out clean.

WRITING.TITLE: Songs that speak to you about recovery
WRITING.TEXT:
Since I'm still relatively new to recovery, I seem to see ED triumph analogies in so many songs. Thought I'd list a few and why they matter to me and see if anyone else had any.
Fight Song by Rachel Platten: this is the first song I heard after my parents found out I had anorexia and I asked them for help. The lyrics motivate me like no other and remind me that even when I'm down, I can keep going. I've lost friends through this process but even though they don't believe in me, I have so much left.
Out of the Woods by Taylor Swift: as I push toward weight restoration, I wonder if I'm out of the woods and into the clear in terms of medical safety as well as mental stability. The clear, to me, is a place where I don't feel the need to restrict and my exercise urges drop. I want to be out of the woods where I've been trapped so long.
Stand by You by Rachel Platten: can you tell I love her? This song reminds me of the great people in my life. My mom especially has been there standing by me and walking through hell. My sister and a few of my old friends as well.
Unwell by Matchbox 20: I'm not crazy, I'm just a little unwell. I find this to be so true. And it helps me to remember that the Ed sucks but it's going to be temporary. I'll get back to how I used to be. Not the exact same because this has been so life changing but back to being well.
There is a slight chance you go to the gym I work at because this happened at my gym last week.
*cue pinball wizard*

No breadth which is super weird. I hate that it's that way. That being said, if you are interested in the language, it's not a waste of time. And it looks good on resumes.
If you took some of the language back in high school, you can get retro credits though which are nice.

This is a big step. A big first step. A few months seems a long time to wait though. Is there anywhere else you can go to get therapy sooner? I've found it super helpful. Have you seen a medical doctor to be sure you're medically stable?
Metcalfes at Hilldale is pretty decent for the Midwest. So hit or miss but good for Wisconsin.
Calc 1. Take it in high school. If you must take it at UW, don't be afraid to switch discussion sections to get a good ta (this holds true for all classes). I was such a naive little freshman.
I thought the first like 1/4 of the class was high school easy with punnet squares and such. And the. It nose dived into complex genetic probability questions and I wanted to cry.
